org.bounce.text.xml
Class XMLFoldingMargin

java.lang.Object
  java.awt.Component
      java.awt.Container
          javax.swing.JComponent
              org.bounce.text.FoldingMargin
                  org.bounce.text.xml.XMLFoldingMargin
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable
public class XMLFoldingMargin
extends FoldingMargin

Line folding margin for a JTextComponent. 

 JEditorPane editor = new JEditorPane();
 JScrollPane scroller = new JScrollPane(editor);

 // Add the number margin as a Row Header View
 XMLFoldingMargin margin = new XMLFoldingMargin(editor);
 scroller.setRowHeaderView(margin);

Author:
Edwin Dankert

Method Detail

getFoldClosingLine

protected int getFoldClosingLine(int start,
                                 int end)
Description copied from class: FoldingMargin
Return the closing line of the fold, the first fold should be located on the first line. If no fold start can be found on the start line, no attempt should be taken to find the a fold start in subsequent lines and the start line should be returned. The closing fold should be located on the line returned however the line returned should not be higher than the limit. If the closing fold cannot be found before the limit, the limit should be returned.

Specified by:
getFoldClosingLine in class FoldingMargin
Parameters:
start - the begin line of the fold.
end - the end-line limit after which there is no need to parse the document anymore.
Returns:
the last line of the fold, not bigger than the end-line limit.
